Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("PeerChannel feature is obsolete and will be removed in the future.", false)

Docs.summary: Defines the binding element used to create a peer message transport channel.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This transport cannot be used with contracts that have request/reply operations.

Docs.typeparam: The type of channel to produce.
Docs.param: that specifies the binding context for the channel factory.
Docs.summary: Creates a channel factory that can be used to create a channel for sending messages.
Docs.returns: that contains the new channel factory of the specified type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method can be used to get a channel factory based on the configuration of the transport binding element.
## Examples This method can be used to get a channel factory for sending messages based on the configuration of the transport binding element.

Docs.exception: Manual addressing was specified in the binding context for this channel factory.
The channel type indicated by this binding context is not supported.

Docs.summary: Gets and sets the value that specifies the maximum size, in bytes, of messages sent over transport channels created by this binding element.
Docs.value: The maximum size of messages sent over transport channels created by this binding element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default message size is 65,536 bytes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default value for this property is "p2p".
